Math functions for Point3D manipulations.

Static Methods

parameters
p_oV The first Point3D
p_oW The second Point3D
returns
The resulting Point3D
Adds two 3D vectors.

parameters
p_oW The first Point3D
p_oV The second Point3D

Computes the cross product of two 3D vectors.

distance(pA : sandy.core.data.Point3D, pB : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : Float

Returns the distance between two Point3Ds

distanceSquared(pA : sandy.core.data.Point3D, pB : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : Float

Returns the distance squared between two Point3Ds. This method avoids the overhead of a Math.sqrt() call.

p_oV The first Point3D
p_oW The second Point3D

parameters
p_oV The first Point3D
p_oW The second Point3D

returns
The opposed Point3D.

normalize(p_oV : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : Bool

parameters
p_oV The Point3D to normalize
returns
true if the normalization was successful, false otherwise.
Normalizes a 3d Point3D.

pow(p_oV : sandy.core.data.Point3D, p_nExp : Float) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

parameters
p_oV The Point3D.
p_nExp The exponent
returns
The resulting Point3D.
Computes the power of a 3D Point3D.

Here the meaning of the power of a Point3D is a new Point3D
where each element is the the n:th power of the corresponding element.

Ex: A^n = ( A.x^n, A.y^n, A.z^n )

scale(p_oV : sandy.core.data.Point3D, n : Float) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

parameters
p_oV The Point3D to multiply
n The scaler to multiply
returns
The resulting Point3D
Multiplies a 3D Point3D by specified scalar.

sphrand(inner : Float, outer : Float) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

Returns a random Point3D contained betweeen the first and second values

sub(p_oV : sandy.core.data.Point3D, p_oW : sandy.core.data.Point3D) : sandy.core.data.Point3D

parameters
p_oV The Point3D to subtract from
p_oW The Point3D to subtract
returns
The resulting Point3D
Substracts one 3D Point3D from another
